003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.

007 * All rights reserved. Visit https://imagingbook.com for additional details.
008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.geometry.fitting.line;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.SlopeInterceptLine;
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * This class implements line fitting by linear regression to a set of 2D points.
020 * See Sec. 10.2.1 of [1] for additional details.
021 * </p>
022 * <p>
023 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic
024 * Approach</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
025 * </p>
026 * 
027 * @author WB
028 * @version 2022/09/29
029 */
030public class LinearRegressionFit implements LineFit {
031        
032        private final int n;
033        private final double[] p;       // line parameters A,B,C
034        private double k, d;
035        
036        /**
037         * Constructor, performs a linear regression fit to the specified points.
038         * At least two different points are required.
039         * 
040         * @param points an array with at least 2 points
041         */
042        public LinearRegressionFit(Pnt2d[] points) {
043                if (points.length < 2) {
044                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("line fit requires at least 2 points");
045                }
046                this.n = points.length;
047                this.p = fit(points);
048        }
049        
050        @Override
051        public int getSize() {
052                return n;
053        }
054
055        @Override
056        public double[] getLineParameters() {
057                return p;
058        }
059        
060        public double getK() {
061                return k;
062        }
063        
064        public double getD() {
065                return d;
066        }
067        
068        // ----------------------------------------------------------------------
069        
070        private double[] fit(Pnt2d[] points) {
071                final int n = points.length;
072        
073                double Sx = 0, Sy = 0, Sxx = 0, Sxy = 0;
074                
075                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
076                        final double x = points[i].getX();
077                        final double y = points[i].getY();
078                        Sx += x;
079                        Sy += y;
080                        Sxx += sqr(x);
081                        Sxy += x * y;
082                }
083                        
084                double den = sqr(Sx) - n * Sxx;
085                this.k = (Sx * Sy - n * Sxy) / den;
086                this.d = (Sx * Sxy - Sxx * Sy) / den;
087                
088                AlgebraicLine line = AlgebraicLine.from(new SlopeInterceptLine(k, d));
089                return line.getParameters();
090        }
091
092
093        /**
094         * Calculates and returns the sum of the squared differences between
095         * the y-coordinates of the data points (xi, yi) and the associated y-value
096         * of the regression line (y = k x + d).
097         * 
098         * @param points an array of 2D points
099         * @return the squared regression error
100         */
101        public double getSquaredRegressionError(Pnt2d[] points) {
102                double s2 = 0;
103                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
104                        double y = k * p.getX() + d;
105                        s2 = s2 + sqr(y - p.getY());
106                }
107                return s2;
108        }
109        
110}
